definition[0]: a large amount of money that is given to a new employee, in order to persuade them not to go to work for another organization
example[0]: New teachers are given golden hellos.
definition[1]: a large amount of money given to an employee by their new employer to try to persuade them not to go to work for another company
example[1]: They hired anybody, giving six-figure golden hellos to anyone willing to break a contract.
